intro: Cacalia dichroa, commonly known as the two-colored bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive two-colored petals, typically featuring a white base and a blue or purple upper part. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or open habitats. Cacalia dichroa is a member of the Campanulaceae family, known for its showy, tubular flowers.
